intro: Carmichaelia nigrans, commonly known as the black carmichaelia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive black seed pods. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by the development of its unique, elongated seed pods. Carmichaelia nigrans is often found in the understorey of native forests and is an important component of the local flora.
